intro: Elatostema treutleri, commonly known as the small-leaved elatostema, is a herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes nettle species, and is characterized by its small, opposite leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas. Its leaves are usually covered in fine hairs, and it produces small, greenish-white flowers. Elatostema treutleri is known for its ability to thrive in nutrient-poor soils and its role in supporting local insect populations.
